title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: CBI demands maximum punishment for Sanjay Roy - Hindustan Times
summary:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Demands Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The RG Kar rape case has concluded with the court finding accused Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor. A significant outcry followed the case, leading to nationwide protests for justice.

  • The victim was discovered dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024, after being raped.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested after police identified him via a Bluetooth device found near the crime scene.
  • The case fueled widespread protests by junior doctors demanding better security measures in hospitals.
  • The trial commenced on November 12 with Judge Anirban Das overseeing proceedings that involved 50 witnesses and concluded on January 9.
The CBI's lawyer stated, “We demanded maximum possible punishment for Sanjay Roy.”

The case has raised significant concerns over safety in medical facilities and the need for more robust legal actions against such heinous crimes.
newTitle: RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Seeks Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

title: Arvind Kejriwal's car attacked by BJP workers, says AAP; Parvesh Verma makes big counterclaim - The Times of India
summary:
Arvind Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Says AAP; Parvesh Verma Makes Big Counterclaim

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has reported that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's car was attacked by BJP workers during a recent public event.

  • The incident occurred during a visit to a local area where Kejriwal was attending a function.
  • AAP leaders condemned the attack, claiming it reflects the growing intolerance from rival political factions.
  • BJP leader Parvesh Verma denied the allegations and countered that AAP is using the incident for political gain.
  • The Delhi Police have been called to investigate the matter.

“This attack is an embarrassment to democracy, and we will not tolerate such acts,” stated an AAP spokesperson.

This incident raises concerns about political violence and the safety of public figures in the current political landscape.
newTitle: Arvind Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers: AAP Responds

The 2025 Champions Trophy squad has been announced, sparking debates with key decisions regarding player selections. Karun Nair, despite impressive performances, has been left out of the squad, while concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness loom as he has also been included with questions about his ability to participate in early matches.

  • Karun Nair left out of the squad despite strong performances in domestic cricket.
  • Shubman Gill appointed as vice-captain.
  • Jasprit Bumrah included but may not be fit for the initial matches.
  • Mohammed Siraj dropped from the squad.
  • Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledges Nair's form but emphasizes the difficulty of fitting all deserving players into the squad.
Ajit Agarkar: “Averaging 750+ is simply insane, but it's a squad of 15, so we can't fit everyone.”

The squad's composition reflects strategic decisions aimed at optimizing team performance for the upcoming tournament while addressing fitness concerns and leadership roles.

Published: January 18, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) national executive committee held a meeting in Patna on January 18, 2025, where Tejashwi Yadav was named the new president, replacing his father, Lalu Prasad.

  • Tejashwi Yadav's appointment reflects his increased stature within the party.
  • He will be allowed to make decisions regarding party amendments, tickets, and symbols.
  • Currently, he serves as the leader of the Opposition in the Bihar Legislative Assembly.
“The decision was taken as Mr. Yadav’s stature increased in the party.”

This change signifies a pivotal moment for the RJD as it transitions leadership to the next generation.

Watch: Doorbell camera captures sound of meteorite strike in Canada - India Today
summary:
Doorbell Camera Records Rare Meteorite Strike in Canada

Published On: Jan 18, 2025 By: Devika Bhattacharya

A Canadian homeowner captured rare video of a meteorite striking his walkway, producing debris and sound. The incident occurred last July when a meteorite, estimated to be between a golf ball and baseball size, left a small crater.

  • The meteorite created a loud bang and a cloud of dust.
  • Joe Velaidum and his partner were initially puzzled by the debris.
  • The doorbell camera footage helped confirm the event.
  • The meteorite has been named 'Charlottetown' and classified as an ordinary chondrite.
  • This is believed to be the first recorded instance of a meteorite impact caught on video with sound.
  • Nasa reports that 43 tonnes of space debris hit Earth daily.
“Had I stayed in that very spot for just a minute or two longer, I'd certainly have been struck and probably killed by this meteorite.” - Joe Velaidum

This event underscores the rarity and scientific significance of meteorite strikes, especially when captured in such detail.
newTitle: Doorbell Camera Records Rare Meteorite Strike in Canada

Gene therapy exempted from GST; duty cuts on critical medicines for cancer and rare diseases expected - The Financial Express
summary:
Gene Therapy Exempted from GST; Duty Cuts on Critical Medicines for Cancer and Rare Diseases Expected

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Express

The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has announced a full exemption of Goods and Service Tax (GST) on gene therapy, which is crucial for treating life-threatening diseases. This exemption is effective immediately.

  • The GST on gene therapy was previously set at 12%.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had announced this exemption last month.
  • The move is expected to significantly impact patients requiring life-saving treatments.
  • Future proposals may include duty cuts for medicines treating cancer and rare diseases in the Union budget 2025.
  • The National Policy for Rare Diseases (NPRD) was introduced to manage various rare diseases comprehensively.
“An New Entry 105A has been inserted in Notification No. 02/2017-Central Tax (Rate) to fully exempt Gene Therapy from GST,” CBIC stated.

This exemption is anticipated to make critical therapies more affordable, alleviating the financial burden on patients.
newTitle: Gene Therapy Exempted from GST; Duty Cuts on Critical Medicines for Cancer and Rare Diseases Expected

Unstoppable with NBK: Ram Charan’s unknown act of kindness wins hearts - 123telugu
summary:
Unstoppable with NBK: Ram Charan’s unknown act of kindness wins hearts

Published on Jan 18, 2025 2:00 pm IST

Megapower Star Ram Charan is recognized not only for his impressive acting but also for his unpublicized acts of kindness. Recently, a heartwarming story emerged from the Aha team on the show Unstoppable with NBK, showcasing Charan's commitment to helping his fans.

  • A mega fan from Chittoor, known for regular blood donations, faced a tough time with his ailing wife.
  • Learning about the fan's struggles, Ram Charan and his wife Upasana acted quickly to provide free medical treatment at a leading hospital in Hyderabad.
  • For 17 days, the fan's wife received ICU care, with all expenses covered by Charan and Upasana, eliminating the fan's initial worries about hospital bills.
  • The fan shared his touching story in the latest episode of Unstoppable, which has since gone viral on social media.
  • This act highlights Charan’s genuine compassion and lasting impact on his fans.
“Ram Charan’s kindness stands as a testament to his genuine compassion for those who support him.”

This heartwarming story not only enhances Ram Charan's image but also serves as an inspiration to others to support those in need.
newTitle: Ram Charan's Heartwarming Act of Kindness on Unstoppable
